Legal_Issue: Application of incorrect legal test for state protection and persecution
Outcome: Refugee claim denied initially, judicial review allowed
Evidence_Type: Evidence of police corruption, discrimination against Roma in Poland
Legal_Provision: Section 96-98 of IRPA, particularly relating to refugee definition and state protection
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on membership in a particular social group (Roma ethnicity)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Effectiveness of state protection vs. mere serious efforts
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing, followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: IRPA sections on refugee determination and state protection obligations
Application_Error: Misapplication of the legal test for state protection
Review_Outcome: Judicial review allowed, case remanded to a new panel
Assessment_Standard: Whether persecution occurs and whether state protection is adequate and effective
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence of systemic police corruption and anti-Roma discrimination in Poland
Legal_Standard: Adequate and effective state protection required; 'serious efforts' insufficient
Application_Factor: Failure to assess effectiveness of Polish authorities in protecting Roma individuals
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the Boardâ€™s interpretation of state protection unreasonable?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 97(1): Definition of Convention refugee; RPD guidelines on state protection
Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for redetermination by a different Board panel
Cause_of_Refusal: Board found sufficient state protection based on 'serious efforts' rather than actual effectiveness
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 96, s. 97, and related jurisprudence on persecution and state protection
Evidentiary_Issues: Board failed to properly consider evidence of discrimination and lack of effective protection
Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about inadequate reasoning affecting fairness of decision
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Board's legal interpretation
Relevant_Law: Canadian immigration law, Charter considerations, international refugee law
Procedural_Issue: Improper legal test applied by administrative tribunal
Omission_Type: Failure to assess effectiveness of state protection
